tweets.text: The WSBF has launched its latest report this morning: Bricks and Water, Building Resilience for England's Homes.  We were kindly joined by inquiry Chair, Baroness McIntosh of Pickering, Rt Hon Philip Dunne MP @Dunne4Ludlow, Andy Bord from @floodre and Dan Bond from @EnvAgency https://t.co/5TUI83cMtS

The levels of incompetence within the upper reaches of the @EnvAgency have become simply breathtaking in its magnitude and ugliness.

Time for change. Time for ministers to act. Time to go. https://t.co/OzFAjZg3XX

‚ö°Ô∏èBREAKING: @HS2ltd has today felled the Cubbington Pear tree. 250 years old and Tree of the Year 2015.  üò¢

As we said in March this year this scheme has descended into an example of WORST, rather than best, practice. 

#CubbingtonPearTree https://t.co/mL8rImsibI

tweets.text: Major improvements at #ThorneyIsland will not only defend homes from flooding but also create much needed habitat. Help @WTBBC @WatersideCare @EnvAgencyMids @stwater @BhamCityCouncil maintain clear water courses &  @UrbanRiverS_ Habitat Development for the Dippers and Kingfishers young year on year @jjzomerset https://t.co/nVbcnf6M2P @FIN_BBC @PondRiverStream https://t.co/qWuiPEfCbO

@EmmaHowardBoyd @theCCCuk @EnvAgency @WRIClimate @UKCRP_SPF @AtmosScience @GCAdaptation @AdaptOurWorld @AdaptationCCC @DefraGovUK @FCDOClimate We must reduce emissions, you say? Your @EnvAgency just handed out a permit for Europe‚Äôs largest waste incinerator at Rivenhall in rural north Essex. 600,000 tonnes of rubbish will be burned per year and all delivered by 200 lorries per day. How does that reduce CO2 emissions?
